Cautiously standing a good distance away from the figure, Tucson slowly dra=
ws his sword, and keeps it in hand with the blade faced to the ground.  Slo=
wly, he walks toward the figure.

" Hello, are you in need of help?"

Perpe=
tually on the move and constantly busy.

er Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

ng with all sorts of life

ll
> communications appeared to be out. All tracking beacons, com-links and=

munication at all with the outside, and to those outside the jungle

s as if TUSCON and WHEELIE had just disappeared.

y enough, the sensors of anyone with even a

uld be able to pick up a low level 'hum'

the entire area. Not a force field but

e background of things. To those who

hum=E2=80=99 had a Unicronian signature to it

>> <OLD - WHEELIE>
>> 
>> =
Not having a more explicit idea fo what was going on, Wheelie gingerly
>> c=
ontinued, one step at a time, going slowly and warily.  Keeping his energon=

>> slingshot in a subspace pocket but fully charged, so should it come ove=
r to
>> combat he could immediately whip it out to engage someone, and keep=
ing
>> enough space between himself and the underbrush if he was ambushed h=
e would
>> have some room to react.
> 
> <NEW - Wheelie>
> 
> The trek that=
 WHEELIE is on has brought him out into more open areas
> of the jungle. Th=
e canopy of trees has grown unusually thick meaning
> that the underbrush h=
as died back, leaving the floor of the jungle,
> while uneven, relatively c=
lear of plant life. The area is dark, but
> not overly so, much like a day =
in the open as the sun was setting, or
> perhaps behind dense storm clouds.=

> 
> The silence around WHEELIE was becoming more pronounced as he moved
>=
 forward. He could see signs that larger animals had indeed moved
> through=
 the area. The bark had been knocked off or actual dents or
> cuts made in =
the trees themselves.
> 
> Twin optics appeared glowing from the shadows bu=
t strangely enough
> WHEELIE is unable to lock on it with any sort of senso=
rs.
> 
>> <OLD - TUSCON>
>> 
>> As he nears a large tree, his outstretched =
arms allow him to catch a giant
>> branch with both hands as he swings off =
it like a skilled gymnast .  After a
>> spin or two, to build his momentum,=
 he vaults to a lower branch and
>> continues to do so until he finally tou=
ches down for a flawless landing as
>> he uses his arms for balance.  Leaf =
litter falls in his wake as he first
>> looks around to get his bearings.
>=
 
> <NEW>
> 
> As TUSCON landed on the jungle floor high over head a flock =
of birds
> at the top of the canopy of trees rose into the air obviously st=
artled
> by his passing, the sound of their calls filling the air for a mom=
ent.
> However soon enough the birds flew off to find new places to roost a=
nd
> to find food.
> 
> The ground that TUSCON has landed is still relative=
ly open, but he can
> easily make out the path leading further into the jun=
gle where the
> trees and undergrowth would make travel more difficult for =
anyone.
> Large trees surround him on all sides. Many of them had been knoc=
ked

> destru=
ction became less and less the further in he looked.
> 
> Enhanced senses c=
ould easily make out the plethora of life that lived
> in the jungle as ani=
mals and birds of all shapes and sizes made their
> home in the miles and m=
iles of this wooded area. However his enhanced
> senses could also pick up =
the movement of something else, that moved
> out in the brush ahead of him.=
 However his sensors were unable to pick
> up on it. He could see a figure =
ahead that looked vaguely humanoid in
> the distance, although with the bru=
sh and foliage between him and them

and configuration.
